intro: Comptonella albiflora, commonly known as the whiteflower comptonella, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related genera. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
